result.execSummary:
The defendant Isabella Anna Marie Artripe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Kenneth N. Sortedahl, DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman, DF:  Isabella Anna Marie Artripe appeared. There is an agreement. ADA recites agreement. Court reviews constitutional rights with def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court amends charge to 943.23(3m) - Class a misdemeanor, operate w/o owners consent. Court reads charge and possible penalties for count one, as amended. Def pleads No Contest. Court uses complaints/reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates def guilty of count 1 - amended to 943.23(3m) class a misdemeanor - Operate w/o owners consent.  
Court orders:
 - $243.00; payment plan is approved. 
- 45 days in St. Croix County Jail; with credit for 45 days time served. 
Defendant is advised of right to appeal.

Preliminary hearing on August 14, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 5, 2014 at 10:00 am.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Brian N.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
